intro: Paullinia brevispica, commonly known as the short-stalked soursop, is a species of flowering plant in the Sapotaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that develop into round, spiny fruits. The fruit contains a single large seed and is often used in local traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological studies.
